title: Risotto ai Funghi Porcini
description: Creamy Arborio rice cooked slowly with broth, white wine, and dried porcini mushrooms, finished with Parmesan and butter.
instructions: Soak dried porcini in 2 cups warm water for 30 minutes. Remove mushrooms, strain liquid through cheesecloth, and add to broth.
Heat broth with bay leaf in separate pot and keep at gentle simmer.
Clean and slice fresh mushrooms. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in large pan, sauté fresh mushrooms until golden. Set aside.
In heavy-bottomed pot, melt 2 tbsp butter with 1 tbsp olive oil. Cook onion until soft and translucent, about 8 minutes.
Add rice and toast for 2 minutes until grains are hot and slightly translucent at edges.
Add white wine and stir until completely absorbed.
Add soaked porcini mushrooms. Begin adding hot broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly.
Wait until each addition is almost absorbed before adding next ladle. Continue for 18-20 minutes.
After 15 minutes, add sautéed fresh mushrooms. Continue adding broth until rice is al dente and creamy.
Remove from heat. Stir in remaining butter and Parmigiano-Reggiano vigorously (mantecatura).
Cover and let rest for 2 minutes. Adjust seasoning, stir in parsley, and serve immediately.
